com.preemptive.annotation.instrumentation

Annotation Type ExpiryCheck


  • @Retention(value=CLASS)
@Target(value={CONSTRUCTOR,METHOD})
public @interface ExpiryCheck
    Perform an expiration check.

    Performs an expiration check using the expiration parameters. The expiration can be defined by using one of these techniques:

    • Absolute expiration. When used with ExpiryDate and WarningDate the expiration of the application can be set to a fixed point in time. The WarningDate is optional, and if omitted then no warnings are given.
    • Relative expiration. When StartDateSource is used with ExpiryPeriod and WarningPeriod the expiration of the application can be set to a number of days from a dynamic start date. The method or field described by StartDateSource provides a Date that defines the starting dates for the period.
    • Externally defined. When used with ExpiryTokenSource the definition of the expiration can be stored externally. The ExpiryTokenSource returns a Reader that provides the definition of the expiration. If the expiration stored in the token is relative then StartDate must also be provided.

    The expiration check performs one of the following actions:

    • Default action. When used with no value the default actions are taken. If the application is in the warning period a message is generated to System.out. If the application is expired then a message is generated to System.out and a System.exit() is performed with a value of 1.
    • Custom action. The check can be provided with a value that is a method to be called on each check. The method is specified using the same syntax that is used for sources. The signature of the method must be:

      void method(Token)

    A PA message can be sent on expiration if the sendMessage() value is true. If the application already started PA, then no other values need to be provided. If you only want this message sent you have to add the following information to have the expiration check send the message:
    • Application ID - See Application or ApplicationId.
    • Company ID - See Company or CompanyId.
    The following information is optional:
    • Application name - See Application or ApplicationId
    • Application type - See Application or ApplicationType
    • Application version - See Application, ApplicationVersion, or ApplicationVersionSource
    • Application instance ID - See Application or ApplicationInstanceIdSource
    • Company name - See Company or CompanyName
    • Use SSL - See UseSSL
    The expiration check will automatically start and stop PA when this information is available.
    See Also:
    ExpiryDate, WarningDate, ExpiryPeriod, WarningPeriod, StartDateSource, ExpiryTokenSource, ApplicationStart, Specifying Sources and Actions

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String action
      The custom action method that will be called on each check.
      boolean sendMessage
      Should a PA expiration or expiration warning message be sent.
      InjectionPoint where
      The location in the method where instrumentation will take place.

    • Element Detail

      • action

        public abstract java.lang.String action
        The custom action method that will be called on each check. If blank the default actions take place. Only method actions are supported. The method must take a Token instance.
        See Also:
        Specifying Sources and Actions
        Default:
        ""

      • sendMessage

        public abstract boolean sendMessage
        Should a PA expiration or expiration warning message be sent. By default no message is sent.
        Default:
        false

      • where

        public abstract InjectionPoint where
        The location in the method where instrumentation will take place.
        Default:
        com.preemptive.annotation.instrumentation.InjectionPoint.Beginning
